abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Economic Recovery
            Development Policy Credit Project for Moldova were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was substantial, Bank performance was satisfactory,
            and Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: Strategic and extensive analytical
            work can help with both program design and government
            commitment. Good coordination with other development
            partners can help advance reform. The choice of the number
            of policy areas supported must balance the gains from
            cross-sectoral synergies with the burden of intersectoral
            coordination. Reforms with a fragile and polarized support
            base can be achieved in an uncertain political environment,
            but their sustainability is fragile. Opportunistic
            sequencing and an understanding of the political economy of
            reform are required to foster progress under high political uncertainty.
